content.webTitle: Trump 'weighed in' on junior's words, says White House | The minute

fields.headline: Trump 'weighed in' on junior's words, says White House
fields.bodyText: The White House press secretary, Sarah Huckabee Sanders, seemed to confirm that Donald Trump was personally involved in drafting an initial misleading statement from his son Donald Jr about his meeting with a Russian lawyer. ‘As any father would’ The statement that Don Jr issued is true. There’s no inaccuracy in the statement. The president weighed in as any father would, based on the limited information that he had. – Sarah Huckabee Sanders The Washington Post reported on Monday night that the president “personally dictated” the statement from Don Jr, which said he and Natalia Veselnitskaya “primarily discussed a program about the adoption of Russian children” when they met in June 2016. We primarily discussed a program about the adoption of Russian children that was active and popular with American families years ago and was since ended by the Russian government, but it was not a campaign issue at the time and there was no follow-up. – Donald Trump Jr The former White House ethics lawyer Richard Painter was more worried than Huckabee Sanders. “You’re boxing in a witness into a false story,” he told the Guardian. “That puts them under enormous pressure to turn around and lie under oath to be consistent with their story. I think it’s obstruction of justice.” Trump ‘obstructed justice’ Meanwhile, Trump’s proposed ban on transgender service members faced opposition from more than 50 retired generals and admirals, who warned that the discriminatory policy would degrade military readiness and harm morale. ‘Reverse transgender ban’ This proposed ban, if implemented, would cause significant disruptions, deprive the military of mission-critical talent and compromise the integrity of transgender troops who would be forced to live a lie. – Letter from 50+ retired generals The US commander-in-chief’s attitude towards the police also prompted criticism. The acting director of the DEA criticized Trump for telling law enforcement officers not to be “too nice” to suspects, saying he felt compelled to speak out when “something is wrong”. Acting agency chief speaks out The president, in remarks delivered … in New York, condoned police misconduct regarding the treatment of individuals placed under arrest by law enforcement. – Chuck Rosenberg Do you recall Anthony Scaramucci, the White House communications director hired on 21 July and fired on 31 July? He had one more treat in store: a British hoaxer pretended to be his bête noire Reince Preibus and drew the Mooch into a series of ill-advised emails. Prankster targeted Scaramucci Read Shakespeare. Particularly Othello … You know what you did. We all do. Even today. But rest assured we were prepared. A Man would apologize. – Scaramucci to ‘Priebus’ It emerged that Trump’s former press secretary, Sean Spicer, was given advance notice about a sensational but later retracted Fox News story on the murder of Democratic aide Seth Rich, whose death has spawned numerous rightwing conspiracy theories. Spicer had notice of story It might take just a minute to catch up on the latest politics news. But good journalism takes time and costs money.
